data.meta_description: Get breaking news on the biggest stories, follow your favourite teams and sports, check live scores, and catch up with highlights from the biggest competitions.â¦
data.text:
Get breaking news on the biggest stories, follow your favourite teams and sports, check live scores, and catch up with highlights from the biggest competitions. With a Sky Sports subscription, also watch the best live action with access to all Sky Sports channels.

See what is happening in football, F1, cricket, boxing, golf, tennis, rugby league, rugby union, darts, NFL, racing, netball and more!

FOLLOW YOUR FAVOURITES:

Add your favourite teams and sports to your home screen, and get straight to the live streams, news, and highlights that matter most to you.

WATCH SKY SPORTS LIVE:

Got a Sky Sports subscription? Watch the biggest sporting events LIVE with access to every Sky Sports channel as well as additional streams, all directly within the app. Premier League, EFL, WSL, SPFL, F1, US Open tennis, ATP & WTA Tours, Super League, Lions Tour, The Open, The Masters, NFL, IPL, The Hundred, Premier League Darts, Netball - we have you covered!

Ride onboard with our F1 driver cameras, switch between multiple tennis matches or watch football clips of key moments whilst enjoying the match live. Get closer to the action than ever before. ONLY in the Sky Sports app.

If you are with Sky Mobile, you can also stream on the Sky Sports app without using your mobile data*.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Watch an unbeatable selection of videos including match highlights, news, interviews and analysis for FREE within the Sky Sports app.

LIVE SCORES:

Stay up to date with live scores for football, cricket, tennis, rugby league and rugby union, as well as live F1 times across all sessions of every Grand Prix.

Please note:

Live streaming and selected videos are only available in the UK and Ireland. Additional mobile network and/or WiFi charges may apply.

To learn more about how Sky uses your data, see our privacy notice at https://www.sky.com/help/articles/privacy-hub-home

Please read the terms and conditions carefully before using the app.

*Requires active Sky Mobile airtime plan and at least 50Mb of data. Go to the Sky website for more information.

Stuieok ,

Camera coverage on prem games

The last two seasons watching the games is soooooooo frustrating. Having played and watched football all my life I find it infuriating that the camera zooms into the players feet the last 20 yards when he receives the ball on the wing. You can't see players arriving in the box. Once the camera zooms back out you are out of sink with the play. Too Mitch time is taken showing or relive the replays and when it gets back to the game the goal kick has been taken and you miss live play. It's getting like American football coverage. We know who the managers are we don't need to see them every two minutes. WHY DOES THE CAMERA ALWAYS LOOK AWAY IF IT LOOKS LIKE A PLAYER MAY REACT BADLY TO A CHALLENGE OR DECISION BY THE REF. WE PAY TO SEE THE FOOTBALL AND WHAT HAPPENS ON THE PITCH. The second half starts and then you decide to put the teams across the screen. If there has been a substitution we will see it. Really is frustrating enough to cancel subscription and just watch match of the day.

Vickymeldrew ,

Bundesliga live streams need fixing

Sky need to sort out their Bundesliga live streams available via this app. Yet again, such a stream repeatedly abruptly throws me out, it can then take several attempts to access the stream again. This problem is now so bad it is hardly worth these streams being available. And not to mention the near-30 second length advert you have to put up with before you can (maybe) see the stream - which also happens upon each attempt to access the stream again after having been abruptly disconnected from it. This happens no matter which device I usr the app from - iPad Air 2 or iPhone 12, both running current (most recent) software versions. On another note - as other reviewers have said, can we please not have womenâs football shoved down our throats so much? It is being forced on us whether we like it or not (along with the likes of netball and womenâs cricket). I wholly agree with the person who is fed up with articles being headed (for example) Manchester United, without any indication it is in fact about the womenâs team; this is just not the same sport - and I am female. There should definitely be more notification options available so that womenâs sport notifications are not forcibly received.
